Yeah you have, if you use ubuntu...it's the default gnome window manager.
No, nautilus is a file manager.
metacity is the program that draws the window borders and close/min/max buttons.
I like it better, it's way more configurable.
if you like functionality, sawfish has it...it's insanely configurable.
Just 'killall metacity' until it stops respawning, run 'sawfish &', and then run gnome-session-save
unfortunately, no clean way to change window managers, at least that I know of.
now system -> preferences -> windows should give you the sawfish config
